text: Kjell Magne Bondevik (; born 3 September 1947) is a Norwegian Lutheran minister and politician (Christian Democratic Party). He served as Prime Minister of Norway from 1997 to 2000, and from 2001 to 2005. He is Norway's longest serving non-Labour Party Prime Minister since World War II. On 31 January 2017, he was the first high-ranking politician from another country detained and questioned in the United States as a result of President Donald Trump's executive orders banning immigration from seven predominantly Muslim nations, because of a diplomatic visit to Iran he had made in 2014. ==References== ==Other websites== * The Oslo Centre for Peace and Human Rights * The Royal Norwegian Order of St Olav Category:1947 births Category:Living people Category:Prime ministers of Norway
title: Kjell Magne Bondevik
